intro: Polyalthia sublanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-lanceleaf polyalthia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
